titles.title: Voter Freedom Act of 1997

To enforce the guarantees of the first, fourteenth, and fifteenth amendments to the Constitution of the United States by prohibiting certain devices used to deny the right to participate in certain elections.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Oversight.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 09/16/1997--Introduced. Voter Freedom Act of 1997 - Entitles an individual to be placed as a candidate on, and to have such individual's political party, body, or group affiliation in connection with such candidacy placed on, a ballot or similar voting materials to be used in a Federal election under specified conditions.
